ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BACKGROUNDCOLOR=style-reference | color] 
      
Specifies the color of the graph background.
Specifies whether a border is drawn around the graph.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that a border is drawn around the graph. This is the default.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that a border is not drawn around the graph.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BORDERATTRS=style-element | style-element (line-options) | (line-options)] 
      
Specifies the attributes of the border line around the graph. 

The available line-options can be any one or more of the following settings. The options must be 
enclosed in parentheses, and each option is specified as a name=value pair:

  COLOR=style-reference | color 
  specifies the line color. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid 
  attribute such as COLOR, CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use 
  CONTRASTCOLOR for lines. If you specify a style element that does not have a CONTRASTCOLOR attribute, 
  the element's COLOR attribute is used. If you use a color, SAS/GRAPH accepts color names, such 
  as RED, or color codes, such as CXFF0000 or #FF0000.

  PATTERN=style-reference | line-pattern-name | line-pattern-number specifies the line pattern. 
  If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINESTYLE. Line patterns can be specified 
  as a pattern name or pattern number. Some valid pattern numbers: 1 (Solid), 2 (ShortDash), 4 (MediumDash), 
  5 (LongDash) 8 (MediumDashShortDash)   14 (DashDashDot) 15 (DashDotDot) 20 (Dash) 26 (LongDashShortDash) 
  34 (Dot) 35 (ThinDot) 41 (ShortDashDot) 42 (MediumDashDotDot). Not all pattern numbers have names.

  THICKNESS=style-reference | dimension 
  specifies the line thickness. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINETHICKNESS.

Specifies the design width of the graph to be obtained from the SAS Registry key Products=> 
Graph=> ODS=>StatGraph=>DefaultDesignWidth when the graph is rendered. The initial value of this registry key is 480px.
Specifies the design width of the graph.

[Syntax: PAD=dimension | (pad-options)] 
      
Specifies the amount of extra space that is added inside the graph border. The default padding for 
all sides is 10. Values without units are in pixels (px). A unit must be provided if other than pixels.

dimension 
  Specifies a dimension to use for the extra space at the left, right, top, and bottom of the layout border. 

(pad-options) 
  Enables separate settings for the left, right, top, and bottom padding dimensions. Use the pad-options 
  to create non-uniform padding. These options must be enclosed in parentheses. Each option is specified 
  as a name=value pair. Sides not assigned padding are padded with the default amount. 
  Values without units are in pixels (px). A unit must be provided if other than pixels.

  LEFT=dimension 
  specifies the amount of extra space added to the left side. 
  RIGHT=dimension 
  specifies the amount of extra space added to the right side. 
  TOP=dimension 
  specifies the amount of extra space added to the top. 
  BOTTOM=dimension 
  specifies the amount of extra space added to the bottom.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ROWVAR=class-var] 
          
Specifies a single row classification variable.

[Syntax: COLUMNVAR=class-var] 
          
Specifies a single column classification variable.

[Syntax: BACKGROUNDCOLOR=style-reference | color] 
          
Specifies the color of the layout background. 

style-element 
A reference in the form style-element:style-attribute. Only the style-attribute named COLOR is used. 

Interaction: OPAQUE=TRUE must be in effect for the color to be seen. By default, OPAQUE=FALSE.
Specifies whether a border is drawn around the layout.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: A border is drawn around the layout.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A border is not drawn around the layout. This is the default.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BORDERATTRS=style-element | style-element (line-options) | (line-options)] 
          
Specifies the attributes of the border line around the layout.

style-element 
    Name of a style element. Only style attributes relevant for rendering the fill, line, data marker, or text will be used.

style-element (line-options) 
    Name of a style element, plus individual options to be used as style overrides. Any options not specified are derived
    from the specified style-element.

(line-options) 
    COLOR=style-reference | color 
    specifies the line color. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid attribute such as COLOR,
    CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use CONTRASTCOLOR for lines.
    
    PATTERN=style-reference | line-pattern-name | line-pattern-number 
    specifies the line pattern. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINESTYLE. 
    Line patterns can be specified as a pattern name or pattern number (1 = Solid, 2-42 Dash/Dot).

    THICKNESS=style-reference | dimension 
    specifies the line thickness. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINETHICKNESS.

[Syntax: CELLHEIGHTMIN=dimension] 
          
Specifies the minimum height of a cell in the grid. Default is 100px.

[Syntax: CELLWIDTHMIN=dimension] 
          
Specifies the minimum width of a cell in the grid. Default is 100px.

[Syntax: COLUMNAXISOPTS=(axis-options)] 
          
Specifies X-axis options for all columns. Axis options must be enclosed in parentheses and 
separated by spaces.
Specifies how the X-axes of instances of the graph-prototype are scaled. The default is UNIONALL.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Scales the X-axis data ranges across all layout columns and panels (when PANELNUMBER= is in effect).
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Scales the X-axis data ranges separately for each column in the layout.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: COLUMNGUTTER=dimension] 
          
Specifies the amount of empty space that is between the columns. The default is 0.
Specifies where to position the outside column header.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that column header text appears at the top of the layout.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that column header text appears at the bottom of the layout.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that column header text alternates between the top and bottom of the layout column by column.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: COLUMNS=integer] 
          
Specifies the number of columns in the layout. 

Default:

  o If this option is not specified, the number of columns is dynamically adjusted to equal the number 
    of classifier values for the COLUMVAR= variable. 
  o If this option is specified, that many columns will be created. If the number of COLUMNVAR classifier 
    values is greater than the specified number of columns, no graph will be created for some classifier 
    values. If the number of classifier values is smaller than the specified number of columns, extra empty 
    columns will be created. 

Interaction: The overall grid size is constrained by the HEIGHT= and WIDTH= options on the 
ODS GRAPHICS statement. As the grid size grows, the cell size shrinks. To control the minimum 
size of a cell use the CELLHEIGHTMIN= and CELLWIDTHMIN= options.

[Syntax: HEADERBACKGROUNDCOLOR=style-reference | color] 
          
Specifies the background color of the cell headers. 

style-reference 
A reference in the form style-element:style-attribute. Only the style-attribute named COLOR is used.

[Syntax: HEADERLABELATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options))] 
          
Specifies the color and font attributes of the data labels.

style-element 
    Name of a style element. Only style attributes relevant for rendering the fill, line, data marker, or text will be used.

style-element (text-options) 
    Name of a style element, plus individual options to be used as style overrides. Any options not specified are derived
    from the specified style-element.

(text-options) 
COLOR=style-reference | color 
    specifies the color of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid
    attribute such as COLOR, CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use COLOR for text.

FAMILY =style-reference | "string" 
    specifies the font family of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTFAMILY.

SIZE=style-reference | dimension 
    specifies the font size of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTSIZE. 

STYLE=style-reference | NORMAL | ITALIC 
    specifies the font style of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTSTYLE. 

WEIGHT=style-reference | NORMAL | BOLD 
    specifies the font weight of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTWEIGHT.

Indicates whether the automatic cell header text includes variable name and value or just the value. 
The default is NAMEVALUE.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The automatic cell header text includes variable name and value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The automatic cell header text includes just the value.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Indicates whether the cell header is placed within each cell (INSIDE) or as row and column headers 
external to the lattice (OUTSIDE).

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The cell header is placed as row and column headers external to the lattice.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The cell header is placed within each cell.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies whether the background for cell headers is opaque (TRUE) or transparent (FALSE).

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The background for cell headers is opaque. This is the default.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The background for cell headers is transparent.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: INSET=(variable-list)] 
          
Specifies what information is displayed in an inset. The variable-list defines one or more
variables whose names and values appear as a small table in the data cells. The variables 
may be either numeric or character. Variable names are separated by spaces.

[Syntax: INSETOPTS=(appearance-options)] 
          
Specifies location and appearance options for the inset information. The appearance-options can 
be any one or more of the settings that follow. The options must be enclosed in parentheses, and 
each option is specified as a name=value pair.

  AUTOALIGN=NONE | AUTO | (location-list) 
  specifies whether the inset is automatically aligned within the layout. 

  BACKGROUNDCOLOR= style-reference | color 
  specifies the color of the inset background. Default is TRANSPARENT.

  BORDER=TRUE | FALSE
  specifies whether a border is displayed around the inset. Default is FALSE.

  HALIGN=LEFT | CENTER | RIGHT 
  specifies the horizontal alignment of the inset. Default is LEFT.

  OPAQUE= boolean 
  specifies whether the inset background is opaque (TRUE) or transparent (FALSE). Default is FALSE.

  TEXTATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options) 
  specifies the text properties of the entire inset.

  VALIGN=TOP | CENTER |BOTTOM 
  specifies the vertical alignment of the inset. Default is TOP.

Specifies whether the layout background is opaque (TRUE) or transparent (FALSE). The default 
is FALSE.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the layout background is transparent.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the layout background is opaque.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PAD=dimension | (pad-options)] 
          
Specifies the amount of extra space that is added inside the layout border. The default padding 
for all sides is 0. Values without units are in pixels (px). A unit must be provided if other than pixels.

dimension 
Specifies a dimension to use for the extra space at the left, right, top, and bottom of the layout border. 

(pad-options) 
Enables separate settings for the left, right, top, and bottom padding dimensions. Use the pad-options to
create non-uniform padding. These options must be enclosed in parentheses.

Values without units are in pixels (px). A unit must be provided if other than pixels.

    LEFT=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the left side. 

    RIGHT=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the right side. 

    TOP=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the top. 

    BOTTOM=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the bottom.

[Syntax: PANELNUMBER=positive-integer] 
          
Specifies the number of the panel to produce. The default is 1.

[Syntax: ROWAXISOPTS=(axis-options)] 
          
Specifies Y-axis options for all rows.
Specifies how the Y-axes of instances of the graph-prototype are scaled. The default is UNIONALL.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Scales the Y-axis data ranges across all layout rows and panels (when PANELNUMBER= is in effect).
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Scales the Y-axis data ranges separately for each row in the layout.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ROWGUTTER=dimension] 
          
Specifies the amount of empty space between the rows. The default is 0.
Specifies where to position the outside row header.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that row header appears at the right of the layout.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that row header appears at the left of the layout.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that row header alternates between the right and left of the layout row by row.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ROWS=integer] 
          
Specifies the number of rows in the layout.

Specifies whether the external axes skip the empty cells in a partially filled grid. The default 
is false.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: External axes are displayed at their normal locations, even if there are empty cells at one or  more of the locations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: External axes skip empty cells and "snap" to the nearest data cell, both vertically  and horizontally. Though the empty cells are not displayed, the data cells in the grid are  not enlarged to fill the area.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Indicates whether to start populating the grid from the top-left or bottom-left corner. The default 
is TOPLEFT.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies to start populating the grid from the top-left corner.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies to start populating the grid from the bottom-left corner.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ASPECTRATIO=AUTO | positive-number

Specifies the aspect ratio of the prototype cell.  The ratio is expressed as a positive decimal 
fraction representing wall-height divided by wall-width. For example, 0.75 is a 3/4 aspect ratio 
and 1.0 is a square aspect ratio. 

Default: AUTO. The prototype cell is sized to the maximum area that can fill the available space inside the layout cell.  
Note: If AUTO is not used for the aspect ratio, then the entire DATALATTICE or DATAPANEL grid is affected and changes shape.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: A border is drawn around the layout.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A border is not drawn around the layout. This is the default.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CYCLEATTRS=boolean 
          
Specifies whether the default visual attributes of markers, lines, and fills in nested plot
statements automatically change from plot to plot. Default: FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Does not cycle the default visual attributes of multiple plots.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The system looks at the plots in the layout and tries to use the GraphData1 - GraphDataN style  elements to assign different visual properties to applicable plots (scatter plots and series  plots and others).

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: WALLCOLOR=style-reference | color] 
          
Specifies the fill color of the plot wall area. 

style-reference is a reference in the form style-element:style-attribute. 
Only the style-attribute named COLOR is used. 

Default: The GraphWalls:Color style reference.

[Syntax: WALLDISPLAY=STANDARD | ALL | NONE | (display-options)] 
          
Specifies whether the plot wall and wall outline are displayed. 

Default: STANDARD

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Displays a filled wall. The setting of the FRAMEBORDER= ON | OFF attribute of the GraphWalls style element determines whether the wall outline is displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Displays a filled, outlined wall.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Displays no wall, no wall outline.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: These options must be enclosed in parentheses and include one of the following:  OUTLINE  displays the wall outline.   FILL  displays a filled wall area.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CLASSVARS=(class-var1 ... class-varN)] 
          
Specifies a list of classification variables. By default, a data cell is created for each crossing 
of these variables in the input data, and the total number of grid cells created is the result of a 
cross-tabulation table of all the classification variables plus any empty cells needed to complete 
the last row/column of the grid. You can request that data cells be generated for all possible crossings, 
even when the class variables have no values at those crossings.

[Syntax: BACKGROUNDCOLOR=style-reference | color] 
          
Specifies the color of the layout background. 

style-element 
A reference in the form style-element:style-attribute . Only the style-attribute named COLOR is used. 

Interaction: OPAQUE=TRUE must be in effect for the color to be seen. By default, OPAQUE=FALSE.
Specifies whether a border is drawn around the layout.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: A border is drawn around the layout.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A border is not drawn around the layout. This is the default.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies whether crossings of the class variables include only the crossings in the data or all 
possible crossings. Default: FALSE.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Data cells are created only for crossings of the class variables that are in the data.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The number of data cells is the product of the unique values for each classification variable.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Indicates whether to start populating the grid cells from the top-left or bottom-left corner. The default 
is TOPLEFT.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies to start populating the grid cells from the top-left corner.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies to start populating the grid cells from the bottom-left corner.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies whether this layout is automatically aligned within its parent when nested within an overlay-type layout.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Available only if the parent layout contains a scatter plot; ignored otherwise. Within the parent layout,  attempt to center this layout in the area that is farthest from any surrounding data point markers.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Do not automatically align this layout within its parent layout. This layout's position within its parent  layout will be set by the HALIGN= and VALIGN= options.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Within the parent layout, restrict this layout's possible locations to those locations in the specified  location-list, and use the location-list position that least collides with the parent layout's other  grahpics features. The location-list is blank-separated and can contain any of these locations: TOPLEFT,  TOP, TOPRIGHT, LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT, BOTTOMLEFT, BOTTOM, and BOTTOMRIGHT.

[Syntax: COLUMNGUTTER=dimension] 
          
Specifies the amount of empty space between the columns. The default is 0.

[Syntax: COLUMNS=integer] 
          
Specifies the number of columns in the layout. 

Default: If ORDER=ROWMAJOR, the default is 1.
If ORDER=COLUMNMAJOR, as many columns are created as needed to satisfy the ROWS= request.

Restriction: Assuming ORDER=ROWMAJOR, if COLUMNS=n and there are m cells defined, and n > m , then 
only m columns will be created (there are n - m cells with zero size).

Tip: This option is used to create a grid with a fixed number of columns, without concern for how many rows.
Specifies this layout's horizontal alignment within its parent when nested within an overlay-type layout.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies a centered horizontal.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies a left-aligned horizontal alignment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies a right-aligned horizontal alignment.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies whether the legend appears inside or outside the plot area when nested within an overlay-type layout.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the legend appears inside the plot area when nested within an overlay-type layout.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the legend appears outside the plot area when nested within an overlay-type layout.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies whether the layout background is opaque (TRUE) or transparent (FALSE). The default 
is FALSE.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the layout background is transparent.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the layout background is opaque.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies whether cells are populated using column priority or by row priority.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Fills all the columns in a row, from left to right, before going to the next row.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Fills all the rows in a column, from top to bottom, before going to the next column.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PAD=dimension | (pad-options)] 
          
Specifies the amount of extra space that is added inside the layout border. The default padding 
for all sides is 0. Values without units are in pixels (px). A unit must be provided if other than pixels.

dimension 
Specifies a dimension to use for the extra space at the left, right, top, and bottom of the layout border. 

(pad-options) 
Enables separate settings for the left, right, top, and bottom padding dimensions. Use the pad-options to
create non-uniform padding. These options must be enclosed in parentheses.

Values without units are in pixels (px). A unit must be provided if other than pixels.

    LEFT=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the left side. 

    RIGHT=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the right side. 

    TOP=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the top. 

    BOTTOM=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the bottom.

[Syntax: ROWGUTTER=dimension] 
          
Specifies the amount of empty space between the rows. The default is 0.

[Syntax: ROWS=integer] 
          
Specifies the amount of empty space between the rows. 

Default: If ORDER=COLUMNMAJOR, the default is 1.
If ORDER=ROWMAJOR, this option is ignored and as many rows are created as needed to satisfy the COLUMNS= request.

Restriction: Assuming ORDER=COLUMNMAJOR, if ROWS=n and there are m cells defined, and n > m , then 
only m rows will be created (there are n - m cells with zero size).

Tip: This option is used to create a grid with a fixed number of rows, without concern for how many columns.
Specifies this layout's vertical alignment within its parent when nested within an overlay-type layout.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies a centered vertical alignment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies a top-aligned vertical alignment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies a bottom-aligned vertical alignment.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies whether a border is drawn around the layout.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: A border is drawn around the layout.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A border is not drawn around the layout. This is the default.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: BORDERATTRS=style-element | style-element (line-options) | (line-options)
          
Specifies the attributes of the border line around the layout.

style-element 
    Name of a style element. Only style attributes relevant for rendering the fill, line, data marker, or text will be used.

style-element (line-options) 
    Name of a style element, plus individual options to be used as style overrides. Any options not specified are derived
    from the specified style-element.

(line-options) 
    COLOR=style-reference | color 
    specifies the line color. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid attribute such as COLOR,
    CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use CONTRASTCOLOR for lines.
    
    PATTERN=style-reference | line-pattern-name | line-pattern-number 
    specifies the line pattern. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINESTYLE. 
    Line patterns can be specified as a pattern name or pattern number (1 = Solid, 2-42 Dash/Dot).

    THICKNESS=style-reference | dimension 
    specifies the line thickness. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINETHICKNESS.

Specifies whether the global legend is displayed when any portion of its nested legends cannot be fully 
rendered because of space constraints. 

Default: FALSE

Interaction This option overrides any DISPLAYCLIPPED option that is set on its nested legend statements.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the legend is not displayed when any portion of the nested legend is not entirely rendered.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The legend always appears, even if some parts of the nested legends have been clipped.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: GUTTER=dimension

Specifies the gap between nested layouts.

Default 0 
Note The default units for dimension are pixels.

Specifies the layout’s horizontal alignment within the graph area that is defined by the BEGINGRAPH block.

Default CENTER 

Note When CENTER is in effect and the outermost layout is an overlay-type layout, the global legend is centered 
below the wall area if it can fit within the wall width.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies a centered horizontal alignment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies a left-aligned horizontal alignment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies a right-aligned horizontal alignment.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: LEGENDTITLEPOSITION=LEFT | TOP

Specifies the position of each nested legend’s title.  Specifying LEFT places each title to the left of the legend 
items for that legend. Specifying TOP places each title above the legend items for that legend.

Default LEFT

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Places each title to the left of the legend items for that legend.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Places each title above the legend items for that legend.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: AUTO | dimension | (pad-options) 

Specifies the amount of extra space to add outside the layout border. 
 
AUTO
  specifies that the default outside padding for this component is used. 

dimension
  specifies a dimension to use for the extra space at the left, right, top, and bottom of the legend border.

(pad-options)
  a space-separated list of one or more of the following name-value pair options, enclosed in parentheses:

  LEFT=dimension
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the left side.
  RIGHT=dimension
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the right side.
  TOP=dimension
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the top.
  BOTTOM=dimension
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the bottom.

  Note: Sides that are not assigned padding are padded with the default amount.
  Tip: Use pad-options to create non-uniform padding.
  Default: No padding

Syntax: PAD=dimension | (pad-options) 
          
Specifies the amount of extra space that is added inside the layout border. 

dimension 
Specifies a dimension to use for the extra space at the left, right, top, and bottom of the border. 

(pad-options) 
A space-separated list of one or more of the following name-value-pair options enclosed in parentheses: 

    LEFT=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the left side. Default 0 

    RIGHT=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the right side. Default 0 

    TOP=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the top. Default 0 

    BOTTOM=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the bottom. Default 0

Syntax: TITLE=“string” 

Specifies a title for the global legend.

Default: No title is displayed for the global legend. 

Restriction: The string must be enclosed in quotation marks. 

Tip: The title for the global legend is independent of the titles for its nested legends.

Syntax: style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options) 
          
Specifies the color and font attributes of the global legend title. 

Default: The GraphLabelText style element.

Interaction: For this option to have any effect, the TITLE= option must also be specified. 

style-element 
    Name of a style element. Only style attributes relevant for rendering the fill, line, data marker, or text will be used.

style-element (text-options) 
    Name of a style element, plus individual options to be used as style overrides. Any options not specified are derived
    from the specified style-element.

(text-options) 
COLOR=style-reference | color 
    specifies the color of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid
    attribute such as COLOR, CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use COLOR for text.

FAMILY =style-reference | "string" 
    specifies the font family of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTFAMILY.

SIZE=style-reference | dimension 
    specifies the font size of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTSIZE. 

STYLE=style-reference | NORMAL | ITALIC 
    specifies the font style of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTSTYLE. 

WEIGHT=style-reference | NORMAL | BOLD 
    specifies the font weight of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTWEIGHT.

TYPE=ROW | COLUMN

Specifies whether nested legends are arranged into a single row or column.

Default ROW 

Interaction: When this option is set to ROW, the relative width of each legend is determined by the setting for the WEIGHTS= option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that nested legends are arranged into a single row.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that nested legends are arranged into a single column.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: WEIGHTS=UNIFORM | PREFERRED | (weight-list) 

Specifies the preferred space allocation for the nested legends. 

Default: UNIFORM 

Restriction: The option is supported only for TYPE=ROW. 

Tip When a weight-list is specified, all the legends using PREFERRED get their preferred space. 
Any remaining space is divided among the legends, in proportion to the numeric values specified 
in the weight-list.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Allocates an equal amount of space for all nested legends.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Allocates the preferred amount of space for each nested legend.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: A space-separated list of preferred space allocations, enclosed in parentheses. The list can combine  numbers with the keyword PREFERRED. Each number is a proportional weight for the corresponding nested legend  (the weights do not have to sum to 1.0). Keyword PREFERRED specifies that the corresponding nested legend  should be allocated its preferred space. The order of the weights that are specified in the list should  correspond to the order of the legend statements that are nested in the GLOBALLEGEND layout.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies whether this layout is automatically aligned within its parent when nested within an overlay-type layout.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Available only if the parent layout contains a scatter plot; ignored otherwise. Within the parent layout,  attempt to center this layout in the area that is farthest from any surrounding data point markers.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Do not automatically align this layout within its parent layout. This layout's position within its parent  layout will be set by the HALIGN= and VALIGN= options.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Within the parent layout, restrict this layout's possible locations to those locations in the specified  location-list, and use the location-list position that least collides with the parent layout's other  grahpics features. The location-list is blank-separated and can contain any of these locations: TOPLEFT,  TOP, TOPRIGHT, LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT, BOTTOMLEFT, BOTTOM, and BOTTOMRIGHT.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BACKGROUNDCOLOR=style-reference | color] 
          
Specifies the color of the layout background. 

style-element 
A reference in the form style-element:style-attribute . Only the style-attribute named COLOR is used. 

Interaction: OPAQUE=TRUE must be in effect for the color to be seen. By default, OPAQUE=FALSE.
Specifies whether a border is drawn around the layout.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: A border is drawn around the layout.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A border is not drawn around the layout. This is the default.

style-element (line-options)

    from the specified style-element.

(line-options) 
    COLOR=style-reference | color 
    specifies the line color. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid attribute such as COLOR,
    CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use CONTRASTCOLOR for lines.
    
    PATTERN=style-reference | line-pattern-name | line-pattern-number 
    specifies the line pattern. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINESTYLE.

    THICKNESS=style-reference | dimension 
    specifies the line thickness. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINETHICKNESS.
Specifies how the X-axes of instances of the graph-prototype are scaled. The default is UNIONALL.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Scales the X-axis data ranges across all layout columns and panels (when PANELNUMBER= is in effect).
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Scales the X-axis data ranges separately for each column in the layout.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: COLUMNGUTTER=dimension] 
          
Specifies the amount of empty space between the columns. The default is 0.

[Syntax: COLUMNS=integer] 
          
Specifies the number of columns in the layout. 

Default: If ORDER=ROWMAJOR, the default is 1.
If ORDER=COLUMNMAJOR, as many columns are created as needed to satisfy the ROWS= request.

Restriction: Assuming ORDER=ROWMAJOR, if COLUMNS=n and there are m cells defined, and n > m , then 
only m columns will be created (there are n - m cells with zero size).

Tip: This option is used to create a grid with a fixed number of columns, without concern for how many rows.

[Syntax: COLUMNWEIGHTS= (numeric-list)] 
          
Specifies the fractional proportion of each cell relative to the overall grid width, not including 
headers, sidebars, and column axes. 

Requirement: numeric-list must be enclosed in parentheses. If there are n columns, then the list 
specified should contain n values and the sum of the weights should be 1.0.
Specifies this layout's horizontal alignment within its parent when nested within an overlay-type layout.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies a centered horizontal alignment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies a left-aligned horizontal alignment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies a right-aligned horizontal alignment.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PAD=dimension | (pad-options)] 
          
Specifies the amount of extra space that is added inside the layout border. The default padding 
for all sides is 0. Values without units are in pixels (px). A unit must be provided if other than pixels.

dimension 
Specifies a dimension to use for the extra space at the left, right, top, and bottom of the layout border. 

(pad-options) 
Enables separate settings for the left, right, top, and bottom padding dimensions. Use the pad-options to
create non-uniform padding. These options must be enclosed in parentheses.

Values without units are in pixels (px). A unit must be provided if other than pixels.

    LEFT=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the left side. 

    RIGHT=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the right side. 

    TOP=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the top. 

    BOTTOM=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the bottom.
Specifies how the Y-axis data ranges of graphs within the layout rows are scaled.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Scales the Y-axis data ranges separately for each cell in the layout.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Scales the Y-axis data ranges separately for each row in the layout. This setting is only supported  if all plots down the row can share the same data range and axis type.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Scales the Y-axis data ranges across all rows in the layout. This setting is only supported if all  plots down the row can share the same data range and axis type.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ROWGUTTER=dimension] 
          
Specifies the amount of empty space between the rows. The default is 0. 

Tip: If there are n rows, then there are n -1 gutters.

[Syntax: ROWS=integer] 
          
Specifies the number of rows in the layout. 
Default: If ORDER=COLUMNMAJOR, the default is 1.

If ORDER=ROWMAJOR, as many ROWS are created as needed to satisfy the COLUMNS= request.

Interaction: If both ROWS=n and COLUMNS=m is specified, an n by m grid of cells is created. If the 
number of statements that define cell contents is greater than n x m , the grid size does not expand 
and some statements will not be displayed. If the number of statements that define cell contents is 
less than n x m , the grid will contain empty cells.

[Syntax: ROWWEIGHTS=(numeric-list)] 
          
Specifies the fractional proportion of each cell relative to the overall grid height, not including 
headers, sidebars, and row axes. 

Requirement: numeric-list must be enclosed in parentheses. If there are n columns, then the list 
specified should contain n values and the sum of the weights should be 1.0.

Specifies whether the external axes skip the empty cells in a partially filled grid. The default 
is false.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: External axes are displayed at their normal locations.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Empty cells are skipped by external axes and the axes "snap" to the nearest populated cell, both vertically and horizontally.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies this layout's vertical alignment within its parent when nested within an overlay-type layout.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies a centered vertical alignment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies a top-aligned vertical alignment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies a bottom-aligned vertical alignment.

style-element

Interaction: OPAQUE=TRUE must be in effect for the color to be seen. By default, OPAQUE=FALSE.

style-element 
    Name of a style element. Only style attributes relevant for rendering the fill, line, data marker, or text will be used.

style-element (line-options) 
    Name of a style element, plus individual options to be used as style overrides. Any options not specified are derived
    from the specified style-element.

(line-options) 
    COLOR=style-reference | color 
    specifies the line color. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid attribute such as COLOR,
    CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use CONTRASTCOLOR for lines.
    
    PATTERN=style-reference | line-pattern-name | line-pattern-number 
    specifies the line pattern. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINESTYLE. 
    Line patterns can be specified as a pattern name or pattern number (1 = Solid, 2-42 Dash/Dot).

    THICKNESS=style-reference | dimension 
    specifies the line thickness. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINETHICKNESS.

[Syntax: CYCLEATTRS=boolean] 
          
Specifies whether the default visual attributes of markers, lines, and fills in nested plot
statements automatically change from plot to plot. Default: FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Does not cycle the default visual attributes of multiple plots.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The system looks at the plots in the layout and tries to use the GraphData1 - GraphDataN style  elements to assign different visual properties to applicable plots (scatter plots and series  plots and others).

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: WALLCOLOR=style-reference | color] 
          
Specifies the fill color of the plot wall area. 

style-reference is a reference in the form style-element:style-attribute. 
Only the style-attribute named COLOR is used. 

Default: The GraphWalls:Color style reference.

[Syntax: WALLDISPLAY=STANDARD | ALL | NONE | (display-options)] 
          
Specifies whether the plot wall and wall outline are displayed. 

Default: STANDARD

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Displays a filled wall. The setting of the FRAMEBORDER= ON | OFF attribute of the GraphWalls style element determines whether the wall outline is displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Displays a filled, outlined wall.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Displays no wall, no wall outline.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: These options must be enclosed in parentheses and include one of the following:  OUTLINE  displays the wall outline.   FILL  displays a filled wall area.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A border is not drawn around the layout. This is the default.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BORDERATTRS=style-element | style-element (line-options) | (line-options)] 
          
Specifies the attributes of the border line around the layout.

style-element 
    Name of a style element. Only style attributes relevant for rendering the fill, line, data marker, or text will be used.

style-element (line-options) 
    Name of a style element, plus individual options to be used as style overrides. Any options not specified are derived
    from the specified style-element.

(line-options) 
    COLOR=style-reference | color 
    specifies the line color. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid attribute such as COLOR,
    CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use CONTRASTCOLOR for lines.
    
    PATTERN=style-reference | line-pattern-name | line-pattern-number 
    specifies the line pattern. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINESTYLE. 
    Line patterns can be specified as a pattern name or pattern number (1 = Solid, 2-42 Dash/Dot).

    THICKNESS=style-reference | dimension 
    specifies the line thickness. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINETHICKNESS.

[Syntax: COMMONAXISOPTS= (common-equated-axis-options)] 
          
Specifies one or more axis options to be applied to all displayed axes.

common-equated-axis-options:
  INTEGER=TRUE | FALSE

  TICKSTYLE=OUTSIDE | INSIDE | ACROSS 

  TICKVALUELIST=( numeric-list ) 

  TICKVALUEPRIORITY=TRUE | FALSE

  TICKVALUESEQUENCE=( START=number | END=number | INCREMENT=number)

  VIEWMAX= number 

  VIEWMIN= number

[Syntax: CYCLEATTRS=boolean] 
          
Specifies whether the default visual attributes of markers, lines, and fills in nested plot
statements automatically change from plot to plot. Default: FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Does not cycle the default visual attributes of multiple plots.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The system looks at the plots in the layout and tries to use the GraphData1 - GraphDataN style  elements to assign different visual properties to applicable plots (scatter plots and series  plots and others).

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: EQUATETYPE= FIT | SQUARE | EQUATE] 
          
Specifies how to draw the axis area.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: X and Y axes have equal increments between tick values. The data ranges of both axes are compared  to establish a common increment size. The axes may be of different lengths and have a different  number of tick marks.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Both the X and Y axes have the same length and the same major tick values. The axis length and tick  values are chosen so that the minimum and maximum of both X and Y appear in the range of values  appearing on both axes.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Same as FIT except that neither axis is extended to use available space in the plot area.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies whether the layout background is opaque (TRUE) or transparent (FALSE). The default 
is FALSE.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the layout background is transparent.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the layout background is opaque.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PAD=dimension | (pad-options)] 
          
Specifies the amount of extra space that is added inside the layout border. The default padding 
for all sides is 0. Values without units are in pixels (px). A unit must be provided if other than pixels.

dimension 
Specifies a dimension to use for the extra space at the left, right, top, and bottom of the layout border. 

(pad-options) 
Enables separate settings for the left, right, top, and bottom padding dimensions. Use the pad-options to
create non-uniform padding. These options must be enclosed in parentheses.

Values without units are in pixels (px). A unit must be provided if other than pixels.

    LEFT=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the left side. 

    RIGHT=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the right side. 

    TOP=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the top. 

    BOTTOM=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the bottom.

[Syntax: WALLCOLOR=style-reference | color] 
          
Specifies the fill color of the plot wall area. 

style-reference is a reference in the form style-element:style-attribute. 
Only the style-attribute named COLOR is used. 

Default: The GraphWalls:Color style reference.

[Syntax: WALLDISPLAY=STANDARD | ALL | NONE | (display-options)] 
          
Specifies whether the plot's wall and wall outline are displayed. 

Default: STANDARD

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Displays a filled wall. The setting of the FRAMEBORDER= ON | OFF attribute of the GraphWalls style element determines whether the wall outline is displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Displays a filled, outlined wall.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Displays no wall, no wall outline.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: These options must be enclosed in parentheses and include one of the following:  OUTLINE  displays the wall outline.   FILL  displays a filled wall area.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: XAXISOPTS=(equated-axis-options)] 
          
Specifies one or more X axis options. 

equated-axis-options:
  DISPLAY=STANDARD | ALL | NONE | ( LABEL|LINE|TICKS|TICKVALUES )

  DISPLAYSECONDARY=NONE | ALL | STANDARD | ( LABEL|LINE|TICKS|TICKVALUES ) 

  GRIDATTRS=style-element | style-element (line-options) | (line-options) 

  GRIDDISPLAY=AUTO_OFF | AUTO_ON | ON | OFF 

  LABEL="string" | ( "string" ... "string" ) 

  LABELATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options) 

  LINEAROPTS=( linear-axis-options ) 

  LOGOPTS=( log-axis-options ) 

  OFFSETMAX=AUTO | AUTOCOMPRESS | number 

  OFFSETMIN=AUTO | AUTOCOMPRESS | number 

  SHORTLABEL="string" 
  
  THRESHOLDMAX= number 
  
  TICKVALUEATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options)
  
  TICKVALUEFITPOLICY=policy 
    where policy can be:
      o For Y or Y2 axis: THIN
      o For X or X2: THIN | ROTATE | ROTATETHIN | STAGGER | STAGGERROTATE | STAGGERTHIN
      
  TICKVALUEFORMAT=( format-options ) | DATA | format 
    specifies how to format the values for tick marks. 
    Default format-options: ( MAXWIDTH=8, MAXDECIMALS=6, PREFERREDDECIMALS=2, EXTRACTSCALE=FALSE )

[Syntax: YAXISOPTS=(equated-axis-options)] 
          
Specifies one or more Y axis options. 

equated-axis-options:
  DISPLAY=STANDARD | ALL | NONE | ( LABEL|LINE|TICKS|TICKVALUES )

  DISPLAYSECONDARY=NONE | ALL | STANDARD | ( LABEL|LINE|TICKS|TICKVALUES ) 

  GRIDATTRS=style-element | style-element (line-options) | (line-options) 

  GRIDDISPLAY=AUTO_OFF | AUTO_ON | ON | OFF 

  LABEL="string" | ( "string" ... "string" ) 

  LABELATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options) 

  LINEAROPTS=( linear-axis-options ) 

  LOGOPTS=( log-axis-options ) 

  OFFSETMAX=AUTO | AUTOCOMPRESS | number 

  OFFSETMIN=AUTO | AUTOCOMPRESS | number 

  SHORTLABEL="string" 
  
  THRESHOLDMAX= number 
  
  TICKVALUEATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options)
  
  TICKVALUEFITPOLICY=policy 
    where policy can be:
      o For Y or Y2 axis: THIN
      o For X or X2: THIN | ROTATE | ROTATETHIN | STAGGER | STAGGERROTATE | STAGGERTHIN
      
  TICKVALUEFORMAT=( format-options ) | DATA | format 
    specifies how to format the values for tick marks. 
    Default format-options: ( MAXWIDTH=8, MAXDECIMALS=6, PREFERREDDECIMALS=2, EXTRACTSCALE=FALSE )

[Syntax: BACKGROUNDCOLOR=style-reference | color] 
          
Specifies the color of the layout background. 

style-element 
A reference in the form style-element:style-attribute . Only the style-attribute named COLOR is used. 

Interaction: OPAQUE=TRUE must be in effect for the color to be seen. By default, OPAQUE=FALSE.
Specifies whether a border is drawn around the layout.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: A border is drawn around the layout.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A border is not drawn around the layout. This is the default.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BORDERATTRS=style-element | style-element (line-options) | (line-options)] 
          
Specifies the attributes of the border line around the layout.

style-element 
    Name of a style element. Only style attributes relevant for rendering the fill, line, data marker, or text will be used.

style-element (line-options) 
    Name of a style element, plus individual options to be used as style overrides. Any options not specified are derived
    from the specified style-element.

(line-options) 
    COLOR=style-reference | color 
    specifies the line color. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid attribute such as COLOR,
    CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use CONTRASTCOLOR for lines.
    
    PATTERN=style-reference | line-pattern-name | line-pattern-number 
    specifies the line pattern. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINESTYLE. 
    Line patterns can be specified as a pattern name or pattern number (1 = Solid, 2-42 Dash/Dot).

    THICKNESS=style-reference | dimension 
    specifies the line thickness. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINETHICKNESS.

Specifies that the layout displays the lines that indicate the complete bounding cube of the axis planes. 
          
Default: TRUE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the layout does not display the lines that indicate the complete bounding cube of the axis planes.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the layout displays the lines that indicate the complete bounding cube of the axis planes.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CYCLEATTRS=boolean] 
          
Specifies whether the default visual attributes of markers, lines, and fills in nested plot
statements automatically change from plot to plot. Default: FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Does not cycle the default visual attributes of multiple plots.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The system looks at the plots in the layout and tries to use the GraphData1 - GraphDataN style  elements to assign different visual properties to applicable plots (scatter plots and series  plots and others).

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies whether the layout background is opaque (TRUE) or transparent (FALSE). The default 
is FALSE.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the layout background is transparent.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the layout background is opaque.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PAD=dimension | (pad-options)] 
          
Specifies the amount of extra space that is added inside the layout border. The default padding 
for all sides is 0. Values without units are in pixels (px). A unit must be provided if other than pixels.

dimension 
Specifies a dimension to use for the extra space at the left, right, top, and bottom of the layout border. 

(pad-options) 
Enables separate settings for the left, right, top, and bottom padding dimensions. Use the pad-options to
create non-uniform padding. These options must be enclosed in parentheses.

Values without units are in pixels (px). A unit must be provided if other than pixels.

    LEFT=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the left side. 

    RIGHT=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the right side. 

    TOP=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the top. 

    BOTTOM=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the bottom.

[Syntax: ROTATE=number] 
          
Specifies the angle of rotation. Rotation is measured in a clockwise direction about a virtual 
axis parallel to the Z axis (vertical) and passing through the center of the bounding cube. 
A counterclockwise rotation can specified with a negative value. 

Default: 54

[Syntax: TILT=number] 
          
Specifies the angle of tilt in degrees. Tilt is measured in a clockwise direction about a virtual 
axis parallel to the X axis (vertical) and passing through the center of the bounding cube. 
A counterclockwise rotation can specified with a negative value. 

Default: 20

[Syntax: WALLCOLOR=style-reference | color] 
          
Specifies the fill color of the plot's walls. 

style-reference is a reference in the form style-element:style-attribute. 
Only the style-attribute named COLOR is used. 

Default: The GraphWalls:Color style reference.

[Syntax: WALLDISPLAY=STANDARD | ALL | NONE | (display-options)] 
          
Specifies whether the plot's wall and wall outline are displayed. 

Default: STANDARD

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Displays a filled wall. The setting of the FRAMEBORDER= ON | OFF attribute of the GraphWalls style element determines whether the wall outline is displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Displays a filled, outlined wall.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Displays no wall, no wall outline.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: These options must be enclosed in parentheses and include one of the following:  OUTLINE  displays the wall outline.   FILL  displays a filled wall area.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: XAXISOPTS=(axis-options)] 
          
Specifies one or more X axis options. 

axis-options:
  DISPLAY=STANDARD | ALL | NONE | ( LABEL|LINE|TICKS|TICKVALUES )

  GRIDATTRS=style-element | style-element (line-options) | (line-options) 

  GRIDDISPLAY=AUTO_OFF | AUTO_ON | ON | OFF 

  LABEL="string" | ( "string" ... "string" ) 

  LABELATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options) 

  LINEAROPTS=( linear-axis-options ) 

  LOGOPTS=( log-axis-options ) 

  OFFSETMAX=AUTO | AUTOCOMPRESS | number 

  OFFSETMIN=AUTO | AUTOCOMPRESS | number   
  
  TICKVALUEATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options) 
  
  TIMEOPTS=( time-axis-options ) 

  TYPE=AUTO | LINEAR | TIME | LOG 
    specifies the type of axis to use.

[Syntax: YAXISOPTS=(axis-options)] 
          
Specifies one or more Y axis options. 

axis-options:
  DISPLAY=STANDARD | ALL | NONE | ( LABEL|LINE|TICKS|TICKVALUES )

  GRIDATTRS=style-element | style-element (line-options) | (line-options) 

  GRIDDISPLAY=AUTO_OFF | AUTO_ON | ON | OFF 

  LABEL="string" | ( "string" ... "string" ) 

  LABELATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options) 

  LINEAROPTS=( linear-axis-options ) 

  LOGOPTS=( log-axis-options ) 

  OFFSETMAX=AUTO | AUTOCOMPRESS | number 

  OFFSETMIN=AUTO | AUTOCOMPRESS | number   
  
  TICKVALUEATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options) 
  
  TIMEOPTS=( time-axis-options ) 

  TYPE=AUTO | LINEAR | TIME | LOG 
    specifies the type of axis to use.

[Syntax: ZAXISOPTS=(axis-options)] 
          
Specifies one or more Y axis options. 

axis-options:
  DISPLAY=STANDARD | ALL | NONE | ( LABEL|LINE|TICKS|TICKVALUES )

  GRIDATTRS=style-element | style-element (line-options) | (line-options) 

  GRIDDISPLAY=AUTO_OFF | AUTO_ON | ON | OFF 

  LABEL="string" | ( "string" ... "string" ) 

  LABELATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options) 

  LINEAROPTS=( linear-axis-options ) 

  LOGOPTS=( log-axis-options ) 

  OFFSETMAX=AUTO | AUTOCOMPRESS | number 

  OFFSETMIN=AUTO | AUTOCOMPRESS | number   
  
  TICKVALUEATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options) 
  
  TIMEOPTS=( time-axis-options ) 

  TYPE=AUTO | LINEAR | TIME | LOG 
    specifies the type of axis to use.

[Syntax: ZOOM= positive-number] 
          
Specifies a zoom factor. Factors greater than 1 move closer to the bounding cube, less than 1 move 
farther away. Default: 1

[Syntax: BACKGROUNDCOLOR=style-reference | color] 
          
Specifies the color of the layout background. 

style-reference 
A reference in the form style-element:style-attribute . Only the style-attribute named COLOR or CONTRASTCOLOR is used.

Interaction: OPAQUE=TRUE must be in effect for the color to be seen. By default, OPAQUE=FALSE.
Specifies whether a border is drawn around the layout.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: A border is drawn around the layout.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A border is not drawn around the layout. This is the default.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BORDERATTRS=style-element | style-element (line-options) | (line-options)] 
          
Specifies the attributes of the border line around the layout.

style-element 
    Name of a style element. Only style attributes relevant for rendering the fill, line, data marker, or text will be used.

style-element (line-options) 
    Name of a style element, plus individual options to be used as style overrides. Any options not specified are derived
    from the specified style-element.

(line-options) 
    COLOR=style-reference | color 
    specifies the line color. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid attribute such as COLOR,
    CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use CONTRASTCOLOR for lines.
    
    PATTERN=style-reference | line-pattern-name | line-pattern-number 
    specifies the line pattern. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINESTYLE. 
    Line patterns can be specified as a pattern name or pattern number (1 = Solid, 2-42 Dash/Dot).

    THICKNESS=style-reference | dimension 
    specifies the line thickness. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINETHICKNESS.

Specifies whether the layout background is opaque (TRUE) or transparent (FALSE). 
          
Default: FALSE 

Interaction: When this option is set to FALSE, the background color is not used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the layout background is transparent.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the layout background is opaque.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: AUTO | dimension | (pad-options) 

Specifies the amount of extra space to add outside the layout border. 
 
AUTO
  specifies that the default outside padding for this component is used. 

dimension
  specifies a dimension to use for the extra space at the left, right, top, and bottom of the legend border.

(pad-options)
  a space-separated list of one or more of the following name-value pair options, enclosed in parentheses:

  LEFT=dimension
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the left side.
  RIGHT=dimension
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the right side.
  TOP=dimension
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the top.
  BOTTOM=dimension
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the bottom.

  Note: Sides that are not assigned padding are padded with the default amount.
  Tip: Use pad-options to create non-uniform padding.
  Default: No padding

[Syntax: PAD=dimension | (pad-options)] 
          
Specifies the amount of extra space that is added inside the layout border. 

dimension 
Specifies a dimension to use for the extra space at the left, right, top, and bottom of the border. 

(pad-options) 
A space-separated list of one or more of the following name-value-pair options enclosed in parentheses: 

    LEFT=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the left side. Default 0 

    RIGHT=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the right side. Default 0 

    TOP=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the top. Default 0 

    BOTTOM=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the bottom. Default 0

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: BANDPLOT X = column | expression
      LIMITLOWER = number | numeric-column | expression
      LIMITUPPER = number | numeric-column | expression
      </ option(s)> ; 


BANDPLOT Y = numeric-column | expression
      LIMITLOWER = number | numeric-column | expression
      LIMITUPPER = number | numeric-column | expression
      </ option(s)> ; 

Creates a band plot that typically shows confidence or prediction limits.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: X=column | expression] 
          
Specifies X values. Numeric or character values may be used.

[Syntax: Y=column | expression] 
          
Specifies Y values. Numeric or character values may be used.

[Syntax: LIMITLOWER=number | numeric-column | expression] 
          
Specifies a constant or column representing the X value(s) (when Y= is used) or Y value(s) (when X= is used) 
of the lower band line. If a constant is specified, a straight line is drawn.

[Syntax: LIMITUPPER=number | numeric-column | expression] 
          
Specifies a constant or column representing the X value(s) (when Y= is used) or Y value(s) (when X= is used) 
of the upper band line. If a constant is specified, a straight line is drawn.

Specifies how to connect the data points to form the band lines. Default: VALUES. 
          
Tip: Use CONNECTORDER=AXIS to assure the expected connect order for certain kinds of series 
lines (for example, time series ) when the input data may not be sorted by the X variable 
(or Y variable).

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Connects data points in the order read from the X variable (or Y variable).
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Connects data points as they occur left-to-right along the X axis (or bottom-to-top along the Y axis).

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CURVELABELATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options)] 
          
Specifies the color and font attributes of the band labels.
Default:
  o For non-grouped data, the GraphValueText style element. 
  o For grouped data, text color is derived from the GraphData1:ContrastColor - GraphDataN:ContrastColor 
    style references. The font is derived from the GraphValueText style element. 

The available text-options can be any one or more of the following settings. The options must be 
enclosed in parentheses, and each option is specified as a name=value pair. In all cases, the 
value may be a style-reference in the form style-element:style-attribute .

  COLOR=style-reference | color 
  specifies the color of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid 
  attribute such as COLOR, CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use COLOR 
  for text. If you use a color, SAS/GRAPH accepts color names, such as RED, or color codes, such as 
  CXFF0000 or #FF0000. Color names must not exceed 64 characters. Color codes must not exceed 8 characters 
  and must be in a valid SAS color-naming scheme, such as RGB, CMYK, HLS, or HSV (HSB).

  FAMILY =style-reference | "string" 
  specifies the font family of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTFAMILY. 

  SIZE=style-reference | dimension 
  specifies the font size of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTSIZE. 

  STYLE=style-reference | NORMAL | ITALIC 
  specifies the font style of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTSTYLE. 

  WEIGHT=style-reference | NORMAL | BOLD 
  specifies the font weight of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTWEIGHT.

[Syntax: CURVELABELLOWER= "string" | column] 
          
Specifies a label for the lower band limit. 
Default: no default

Interaction: For non-grouped data, use "string".

Interaction: For grouped data, use a column to define the lower band labels for each group value. 
All of the labels for a specific group value must be the same; otherwise, the results are unpredictable.

Tip: The font and color attributes for the label are specified by the CURVELABELATTRS= option.

Specifies the location of the band labels relative to the plot area. 

Default: INSIDE 

Restriction: OUTSIDE cannot be used when the BANDPLOT is used in multicell layouts such as LATTICE, 
DATAPANEL or DATALATTICE where axes may be external to the grid.

Interaction: This option is used in conjunction with the CURVELABELPOSITION= option to determine 
where the band labels appear.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Places the band label inside the plot area
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Places the band label outside the plot area

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies the position of the band labels relative to the curve line. 

Default: AUTO when CUVELABELLOCATION=OUTSIDE. END when CURVELABELLOCATION=INSIDE. 

Restriction: The AUTO setting is not supported if CURVELABELLOCATION=INSIDE is specified. The START 
and END settings are not supported if CURVELABELLOCATION=OUTSIDE is specified.

Interaction: This option is used in conjunction with the CURVELABELLOCATION= option to determine 
where the band labels appear.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Only used when CURVELABELLOCATION=OUTSIDE. Band labels will be positioned automatically near the  band boundary along unused axes whenever possible (typically Y2 and X2).
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Forces the band labels to appear near maximum band values (maximum-values for horizontal curves,  and maximum Y-values for vertical curves).
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Forces the band label to appear near minimum band values (minimum X-values for horizontal curves,  and minimum Y-values for vertical curves)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Only used when CURVELABELLOCATION=INSIDE. Forces band labels to appear near the beginning of the curve.  Particularly useful when the curve line has a spiral shape.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Only used when CURVELABELLOCATION=INSIDE. Forces band labels to appear near the end of the curve.  Particularly useful when the curve line has a spiral shape.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DATATRANSPARENCY=number] 
          
Specifies the degree of the transparency of the band. This option affects both the fill and outline. 

Default: 0

Range: 0 (opaque) to 1 (entirely transparent)

Specifies whether to display an outlined band area, a filled band area, or an outlined and filled 
band area. 

Default: The value of the DisplayOpts attribute of the GraphBand style element, which is 
DisplayOpts="FILL" by default.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Displays an un-outlined, filled band
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Displays an outlined, filled band
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: A parenthesized list of space-delimited options that must include one of the following:                                      OUTLINE  displays an outlined band   FILL  displays a filled band

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies whether the constant or "step" band is to be drawn to the area bounded by the axes. 

Default: FALSE

Requirement: When this option is used for a constant band, constants must be specified for the upper 
and lower band limits. This requirement does not apply to "step" bands.

Restriction: This option is ignored if the X or Y value is character.

Tip: If this option is not specified, then there can be a small gap between the line and the axis. 
The gap is controlled by the axis offset. If the offset is set to 0, then there is no gap.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the constant or "step" band is not to be drawn to the area bounded by the axes.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies whether the constant or "step" band is to be drawn to the area bounded by the axes.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: FILLATTRS=style-element | style-element (fill-options) | (fill-options)] 
          
Specifies the appearance of the filled band area. 

When specifying the attributes for an area fill, the COLOR fill-option is the only option that 
is currently available. The option must be enclosed in parentheses and specified as a name=value 
pair. The value may be a style-reference in the form style-element:style-attribute.

  COLOR=style-reference | color 
  specifies the fill color. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid 
  attribute such as COLOR, CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use 
  the COLOR attribute for fill areas. If you use a color, SAS/GRAPH accepts color names, such as 
  RED, or color codes, such as CXFF0000 or #FF0000. Color names must not exceed 64 characters. 
  Color codes must not exceed 8 characters and must be in a valid SAS color-naming scheme, such 
  as RGB, CMYK, HLS, or HSV (HSB).

Default:
  o For non-grouped data, the GraphDataDefault:Color style reference. 
  o For grouped data, the Color attribute of GraphData1 - GraphDataN style elements. 

Interaction: Interaction: For this option to have any effect, the fill must be enabled by the 
ODS style or the DISPLAY= option.

[Syntax: GROUP=column | expression] 
          
Creates a separate band plot for each unique group value of the specified column. 
Default:

  o If the band outline is enabled by the ODS style or the DISPLAY= option, each distinct group value 
    is represented in the graph by a different combination of outline color (defined by the 
    GraphData1:ContrastColor - GraphDataN:ContrastColor style references) and outline pattern 
    (defined by the attribute of the GraphData1:LineStyle - GraphDataN:LineStyle style references). 
  o If the band fill is enabled by the ODS style or the DISPLAY= option, each distinct group value 
    is represented in the graph by a different fill color (defined by the GraphData1:Color - GraphDataN:Color 
    style references). 

Restriction: This option can only be used when a numeric column is specified for the upper limit 
or the lower limit of the band plot (the other limit could be a contant, if desired).

Interaction: To label grouped band plots, you must specify CURVELABELLOWER=column and CURVELABELUPPER=column .

Interaction: The group values are mapped in the order of the data, unless the INDEX= option is used 
to alter the default sequence of colors and line patterns.

Tip: The representations that are used to identify the groups can be overridden individually. For example, 
each distinct group value is represented by a different line pattern for the band lines, but the PATTERN= 
suboption of the OUTLINEATTRS= option could be used to assign the same line pattern to all band outlines.

[Syntax: INDEX=positive-integer-column | expression] 
          
Specifies indices for mapping line attributes (color and pattern) to one of the GraphData1 - GranphDataN 
style elements. 

Default: no default

Restriction: For this option to take effect, the GROUP= option must also be specified.

Interaction: All of the indexes for a specific group value must be the same; otherwise, 
the results are unpredictable.

Interaction: The index values are 1-based indices. For the style definitions in GraphData1 - GraphDataN, 
if the index value is greater than N, then a modulo operation remaps that index value to a number less 
than N to determine which style to use.

Specifies the location of the data point relative to the step. 
          
Default: LEFT

Requirement: TYPE=STEP must also be specified for this option to have any effect.

Interaction: If the MODELNAME= option is specified, this option is ignored.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies a LEFT location of the data point relative to the step.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies a CENTER location of the data point relative to the step.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies a RIGHT location of the data point relative to the step.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: LEGENDLABEL= "string"] 
          
Specifies the label of the legends. 
Default: The string specified on the NAME= option.

Interaction: If the GROUP= option is specified, this option is ignored.

[Syntax: MODELNAME= "plot-name"] 
          
Specifies the name of the plot from which to derive the interpolation for the band. 

Default: no default

Requirement: plot-name must be the name that has been assigned on the associated plot's NAME= option.

Interaction: This option overrides the JUSTIFY= and TYPE= options.

Tip: If this option is not specified, then the interpolation is set by the TYPE= option.

[Syntax: NAME="string"] 
          
Assigns a name to a plot statement for reference in other template statements. 
Default: no default

Restriction: The string is case sensitive, cannot contain spaces, and must define a unique 
name within the template.

Interaction: The string is used as the default legend label if the LEGENDLABEL= option is not used.

Tip: The specified name is used primarily in legend statements to coordinate the use of colors 
and line patterns between the graph and the legend.

[Syntax: OUTLINEATTRS=style-element | style-element (line-options) | (line-options)] 
          
Specifies the appearance of the band outlines. 

The available line-options can be any one or more of the following settings. The options must be 
enclosed in parentheses, and each option is specified as a name=value pair:

  COLOR=style-reference | color 
  specifies the line color. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid 
  attribute such as COLOR, CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use 
  CONTRASTCOLOR for lines. If you specify a style element that does not have a CONTRASTCOLOR attribute, 
  the element's COLOR attribute is used. If you use a color, SAS/GRAPH accepts color names, such 
  as RED, or color codes, such as CXFF0000 or #FF0000.

  PATTERN=style-reference | line-pattern-name | line-pattern-number specifies the line pattern. 
  If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINESTYLE. Line patterns can be 
  specified as a pattern name or pattern number. Some valid pattern numbers: 1 (Solid), 2 (ShortDash), 
  4 (MediumDash), 5 (LongDash) 8 (MediumDashShortDash) 14 (DashDashDot) 15 (DashDotDot) 20 (Dash) 
  26 (LongDashShortDash) 34 (Dot) 35 (ThinDot) 41 (ShortDashDot) 42 (MediumDashDotDot). 
  Not all pattern numbers have names. 

  THICKNESS=style-reference | dimension 
  specifies the line thickness. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINETHICKNESS.

Default:
  o For non-grouped data, the GraphDataDefault style element. 
  o For grouped data, the ContrastColor and LineStyle attributes of the GraphData1 - GraphDataN 
    style elements. 

Interaction: For this option to have any effect, the outline must be enabled by the ODS style 
or the DISPLAY= option.

[Syntax: ROLENAME=( role-name-list )] 
          
Specifies user-defined roles for information contained in data columns. 
Default: no default

(role-name-list) 
a blank-separated list of role-name = column pairs. 
For example, ROLENAME= ( TIP1=OBS ) assigns the column OBS to the user-defined role TIP1.

Requirement: The role names you choose must be unique and different from the pre-defined 
roles X, Y, LIMITUPPER, LIMITLOWER, GROUP, CURVELABELUPPER, and CURVELABELLOWER.

Tip: This option provides a way to add to the data columns that appear in tool tips 
specified by the TIP= option.

[Syntax: TIP=(role-list)] 
          
Specifies the information to display when the cursor is positioned over the band plot. 
If this option is used, it replaces all the information displayed by default. Roles for 
columns that do not contribute to the band plot may be specfied along with roles that do. 

Default: The columns assigned to these roles are automatically included in the tool tip 
information: X, Y, LIMITUPPER, LIMITLOWER, and GROUP.

(role-list) 
an ordered, blank-separated list of unique BANDPLOT and user-defined roles. 
BANDPLOT roles include X, Y, LIMITUPPER, LIMITLOWER, GROUP, INDEX, CURVELABELUPPER,
and CURVELABELLOWER. User-defined roles are defined with the ROLENAME= option.

Requirement: To generate tool tips, you must include an ODS GRAPHICS ON statement that 
has the IMAGEMAP option specified, and write the graphs to the ODS HTML destination.

Interaction: The labels and formats for the TIP variables can be controlled with the 
TIPLABEL= and TIPFORMAT= options.

[Syntax: TIPFORMAT=(role-format-list)] 
          
Specifies display formats for tip columns. 
Default: The column format of the variable assigned to the role or BEST6. if no format is 
assigned to a numeric column.

(role-format-list) 
a list of role-name = format pairs separated by blanks. 
  
   ROLENAME=(TIP1=OBS) 
   TIP=(TIP1 X LIMITUPPER LIMITLOWER) 
   TIPFORMAT=( LIMITUPPER= 5.3 LIMITLOWER= 5.3 )
 
Requirement: This option provides a way to control the formats of columns that appear in tool tips. 
Only the roles that appear in the TIP= option are used. Columns must be assigned to the roles for 
this option to have any effect. See the ROLENAME= option.

[Syntax: TIPLABEL=(role-label-list)] 
          
Specifies display labels for tip columns. 
Default: The column label or column name of the variable assigned to the role.

(role-label-list) 
a list of role-name = "string" pairs separated by blanks. 
  
   ROLENAME=(TIP1=OBS) 
   TIP=(TIP1 X LIMITUPPER LIMITLOWER) 
   TIPLABEL=( LIMITUPPER="90% CLU" 
              LIMITLOWER="90% CLL" ) 

Requirement: This option provides a way to control the labels of columns that appear in tool tips. 
Only the roles that appear in the TIP= option are used. Columns must be assigned to the roles for 
this option to have any effect. See the ROLENAME= option.

Specifies how the data points for lower and upper band boundaries are interpolated.
