    Line patterns can be specified as a pattern name or pattern number (1 = Solid, 2-42 Dash/Dot).

    THICKNESS=style-reference | dimension 
    specifies the line thickness. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINETHICKNESS. 
    
Default: The GraphBorderLines style element.

Interaction: BORDER=TRUE must be set for this option to have any effect.

Specifies the horizontal alignment of the text-item.

Default: CENTER

Tip: Each text-item has a horizontal alignment, and text-items with the same alignment are always 
concatenated together.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies a centered horizontal alignment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies a left-aligned horizontal alignment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies a right-aligned horizontal alignment.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies whether the footnote background is opaque (TRUE) or transparent (FALSE). 
          
Default: FALSE 

Interaction: When this option is set to FALSE, the background color is not used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the legend background is transparent.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the legend background is opaque.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PAD=dimension | (pad-options)] 
          
Specifies the amount of extra space that is reserved inside the footnote border. 

Default: (LEFT=3 RIGHT=3 TOP=0 BOTTOM=0)

dimension 
Specifies a dimension to use for the extra space at the left, right, top, and bottom of the footnote border. 

(pad-options) 
Enables separate settings for the left, right, top, and bottom padding dimensions. Use the pad-options 
to create non-uniform padding. These options must be enclosed in parentheses. Each option is specified 
as a name = value pair. Sides not assigned padding are padded with the default amount. 
Values without units are in pixels (px). A unit must be provided if other than pixels.

  LEFT=dimension 
  specifies the amount of extra space added to the left side. 
  
  RIGHT=dimension 
  specifies the amount of extra space added to the right side. 
  
  TOP=dimension 
  specifies the amount of extra space added to the top. 
  
  BOTTOM=dimension 
  specifies the amount of extra space added to the bottom

[Syntax: SHORTTEXT=(text-item <... <text-item>)] 
          
Specifies an alternate footnote to use if the specified footnote is too long for the output width. 
If the shortened text is itself too long, it will be truncated. 
Default: no default

Interaction: This option has no effect unless TEXTFITPOLICY=SHORT.

Interaction: This option is ignored if any text-items include an HALIGN= prefix option.

Interaction: The horizontal alignment of the shortened text is derived from the horizontal alignment 
of the footnote to be shortened.

[Syntax: { SUB "string" | dynamic }] 
        Text-command that specifies that the string or dynamic is to appear as subscript text. 
Default: no default

Example: entryfootnote "y = " b{sub "0"} " + b" {sub "1"} "x";

[Syntax: { SUP "string" | dynamic }] 
          
Text-command that specifies that the string or dynamic is to appear as superscript text. 
Default: no default

Example: entryfootnote "R" {sup "2"} " = " {format (6.4) RSQUARED} ;

[Syntax: TEXTATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options)] 
          
As a statement option, specifies the text properties of the entire entry text. As a prefix-option, 
specifies the text properties of individual text-items. 

Default: The GraphFootnoteText style element.

Tip: This option can be used as both a prefix option and a statement option. When used as a prefix 
option, it overrides the statement option.

Tip: When used as a prefix option, TEXTATTRS=( ) cancels the last used TEXTATTRS= prefix option and 
resets all text options to those set by 1) the TEXTATTRS= statement option or 2) the default style 
element for the statement (GraphFootnoteText) if no TEXTATTRS= statement option is used.

style-element 
    Name of a style element. Only style attributes relevant for rendering the fill, line, data marker, or text will be used.

style-element (text-options) 
    Name of a style element, plus individual options to be used as style overrides. Any options not specified are derived
    from the specified style-element.

(text-options) 
COLOR=style-reference | color 
    specifies the color of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid
    attribute such as COLOR, CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use COLOR for text.

FAMILY =style-reference | "string" 
    specifies the font family of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTFAMILY.

SIZE=style-reference | dimension 
    specifies the font size of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTSIZE. 

STYLE=style-reference | NORMAL | ITALIC 
    specifies the font style of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTSTYLE. 

WEIGHT=style-reference | NORMAL | BOLD 
    specifies the font weight of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTWEIGHT.

Specifies how to handle a footnote that is too long to fit in the output width. 

Default: WRAP 

Interaction: If you specify SHORT for this option, you should assign a shortened version of the footnote 
with the SHORTTEXT= option. If the shortened footnote is itself too long, it will be truncated.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the text wraps to the next line(s).
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the text indictated by the SHORTTEXT= option be substituted when the title will not fit.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that the text is truncated to make it fit.

keyword

Examples:
  
 entryfootnote {unicode alpha} "=" CONF;   
 entryfootnote {unicode "03B1"x} "=" CONF; 

Tip: This text command attempts to access a UNICODE value in the current font. Not all fonts 
support accessing characters via their UNICODE value. Some fonts only support a limited set 
of UNICODE values. If the UNICODE value is not accessible, the command may be ignored or an 
unprintable character may be substituted.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ENTRYTITLE text-item <...<text-item> > </ option(s)> ; 
      
Displays a title.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BACKGROUNDCOLOR=style-reference | color] 
          
Specifies the color of the title background. 

style-element 
A reference in the form style-element:style-attribute. Only the style-attribute named COLOR is used. 

Interaction: OPAQUE=TRUE must be in effect for the color to be seen. By default, OPAQUE=FALSE.

Specifies whether a border is displayed around the title. 
          
Default: FALSE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: A border is displayed around the legend.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A border is not displayed around the legend.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BORDERATTRS=style-element | style-element (line-options) | (line-options)] 
          
Specifies the attributes of the border line around the title.

style-element 
    Name of a style element. Only style attributes relevant for rendering the fill, line, data marker, or text will be used.

style-element (line-options) 
    Name of a style element, plus individual options to be used as style overrides. Any options not specified are derived
    from the specified style-element.

(line-options) 
    COLOR=style-reference | color 
    specifies the line color. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid attribute such as COLOR,
    CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use CONTRASTCOLOR for lines.
    
    PATTERN=style-reference | line-pattern-name | line-pattern-number 
    specifies the line pattern. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINESTYLE. 
    Line patterns can be specified as a pattern name or pattern number (1 = Solid, 2-42 Dash/Dot).

    THICKNESS=style-reference | dimension 
    specifies the line thickness. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be LINETHICKNESS. 
    
Default: The GraphBorderLines style element.

Interaction: BORDER=TRUE must be set for this option to have any effect.

Specifies the horizontal alignment of a text-item.

Default: CENTER

Tip: Each text-item has a horizontal alignment, and text-items with the same alignment are always 
concatenated together.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies a centered horizontal alignment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies a left-aligned horizontal alignment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies a right-aligned horizontal alignment.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies whether the title background is opaque (TRUE) or transparent (FALSE). 
          
Default: FALSE 

Interaction: When this option is set to FALSE, the background color is not used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the title background is transparent.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the title background is opaque.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PAD=dimension | (pad-options)] 
          
Specifies the amount of extra space that is reserved inside the title border. 

Default: (LEFT=3 RIGHT=3 TOP=0 BOTTOM=0)

dimension 
Specifies a dimension to use for the extra space at the left, right, top, and bottom of the title border. 

(pad-options) 
Enables separate settings for the left, right, top, and bottom padding dimensions. Use the pad-options 
to create non-uniform padding. These options must be enclosed in parentheses. Each option is specified 
as a name = value pair. Sides not assigned padding are padded with the default amount. 
Values without units are in pixels (px). A unit must be provided if other than pixels.

  LEFT=dimension 
  specifies the amount of extra space added to the left side. 
  
  RIGHT=dimension 
  specifies the amount of extra space added to the right side. 
  
  TOP=dimension 
  specifies the amount of extra space added to the top. 
  
  BOTTOM=dimension 
  specifies the amount of extra space added to the bottom

[Syntax: SHORTTEXT=(text-item <... <text-item>)] 
          
Specifies an alternate footnote to use if the specified title is too long for the output width. 
If the shortened text is itself too long, it will be truncated. 
Default: no default

Interaction: This option has no effect unless TEXTFITPOLICY=SHORT.

Interaction: This option is ignored if any text-items include an HALIGN= prefix option.

Interaction: The horizontal alignment of the shortened text is derived from the horizontal alignment 
of the title to be shortened.

[Syntax: { SUB "string" | dynamic }] 
        Text-command that specifies that the string or dynamic is to appear as subscript text. 
Default: no default

Example: entrytitle "y = " b{sub "0"} " + b" {sub "1"} "x";

[Syntax: { SUP "string" | dynamic }] 
          
Text-command that specifies that the string or dynamic is to appear as superscript text. 
Default: no default

Example: entrytitle "R" {sup "2"} " = " {format (6.4) RSQUARED} ;

[Syntax: TEXTATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options)] 
          
As a statement option, specifies the text properties of the entire entry text. As a prefix-option, 
specifies the text properties of individual text-items. 

Default: The GraphValueText style element.
Tip: This option can be used as both a prefix option and a statement option. When used as a prefix option, 
it overrides the statement option.

Tip: When used as a prefix option, TEXTATTRS=( ) cancels the last used TEXTATTRS= prefix option and 
resets all text options to those set by 1) the TEXTATTRS= statement option or 2) the default style 
element for the statement (GraphValueText) if no TEXTATTRS= statement option is used. 

style-element 
    Name of a style element. Only style attributes relevant for rendering the fill, line, data marker, or text will be used.

style-element (text-options) 
    Name of a style element, plus individual options to be used as style overrides. Any options not specified are derived
    from the specified style-element.

(text-options) 
COLOR=style-reference | color 
    specifies the color of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid
    attribute such as COLOR, CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use COLOR for text.

FAMILY =style-reference | "string" 
    specifies the font family of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTFAMILY.

SIZE=style-reference | dimension 
    specifies the font size of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTSIZE. 

STYLE=style-reference | NORMAL | ITALIC 
    specifies the font style of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTSTYLE. 

WEIGHT=style-reference | NORMAL | BOLD 
    specifies the font weight of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTWEIGHT.

Specifies how to handle a footnote that is too long to fit in the output width. 

Default: WRAP 

Interaction: If you specify SHORT for this option, you should assign a shortened version of the footnote 
with the SHORTTEXT= option. If the shortened footnote is itself too long, it will be truncated.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the text wraps to the next line(s).
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the text indictated by the SHORTTEXT= option be substituted when the title will not fit.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that the text is truncated to make it fit.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: { UNICODE "hex-string"x | keyword | dynamic }] 
          
Text-command that specifies a glyph (character) to be displayed using its unicode specification or 
keyword equivalent. Default: no default

"hex-string"x 
A four-byte hexadecimal constant that represents a UNICODE character in the current font. 
For a complete listing, see http://www.unicode.org/charts/charindex.html. 

keyword 
A SAS keyword for a UNICODE character. For a listing of SAS-supplied keywords, 
see "Reserved Keywords and Unicode Values". 

dynamic 
The dynamic must resolve to either "hex-string"x or a keyword for a UNICODE character. 
Examples:
  
   entrytitle {unicode alpha} "=" CONF;   
   entrytitle {unicode "03B1"x} "=" CONF; 

Tip: This text command attempts to access a UNICODE value in the current font. Not all fonts 
support accessing characters via their UNICODE value. Some fonts only support a limited set 
of UNICODE values. If the UNICODE value is not accessible, the command may be ignored or an 
unprintable character may be substituted.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ENDCOLUMNAXES ;
      
Signals the end of a COLUMNAXES block.

Syntax: ENDCOLUMN2AXES ;
      
Signals the end of a COLUMN2AXES block.

Syntax: COLUMNAXIS / external-axis-options 
      
COLUMNAXIS statements can be used to simplify and clarify the layout by displaying 
only the external X axes in the resulting graph.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DISCRETEOPTS=( discrete-axis-options )] 
          
Specifies one or more options for a discrete X or X2 axis.

[Syntax: DISPLAY= STANDARD | ALL | NONE | (display-options)] 
          
Controls which axis features are displayed on the primary axis.

Default: STANDARD

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the LABEL, LINE, TICKS, and TICKVALUES are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the LABEL, LINE, TICKS, and TICKVALUES are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that no axis features are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: A parenthesized list of space-delimited options. The list must include one or more  of the following:     LABEL    displays the axis label    LINE    displays the axis line    TICKS    displays the tick marks    TICKVALUES    displays the values that are represented by the major tick marks       Tip: The default line attributes for the axis line and axis tick marks are defined in the    GraphAxisLine style element.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DISPLAYSECONDARY= STANDARD | ALL | NONE | (display-options)] 
          
Controls which axis features are displayed on the secondary axis. 

Default: NONE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the LABEL, LINE, TICKS, and TICKVALUES are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the LABEL, LINE, TICKS, and TICKVALUES are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that no axis features are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: A parenthesized list of space-delimited options. The list must include one or more  of the following:     LABEL    displays the axis label    LINE    displays the axis line    TICKS    displays the tick marks    TICKVALUES    displays the values that are represented by the major tick marks       Tip: The secondary axis is a duplicate of the primary axis (the axis to which the data    are mapped). It is on the opposite side of the lattice from the primary axis.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: GRIDATTRS=style-element | style-element (line-options) | (line-options)] 
          
Specifies the attributes of the grid lines. 

Default: The GraphGridLines style element.

Interaction: This option is ignored if the GRIDDISPLAY= option does not display 
the grid lines.
Specifies how the grid lines are to be displayed.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that grid lines will not be displayed unless the GraphGridLines element  in the current style contains DisplayOpts="ON".
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that grid lines will be displayed unless the GraphGridLines element in  the current style contains DisplayOpts="OFF".
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that grid lines will always be displayed. The current style has no override.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Specifies that grid lines will never be displayed. The current style has no override.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: LABEL="string" | ( "string" ... "string" )] 
          
Specifies the axis label. The "string" may be either a string literal or a dynamic. 
The list form implies that all included string literals or dynamics will be concatenated 

Default: The default label is derived from the primary plot in the layout.

[Syntax: LABELATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options)] 
          
Specifies the color and font attributes of the axis label. 

Default: The GraphLabelText style element.

Interaction: This option is ignored if the DISPLAY= or DISPLAYSECONDARY= option does 
not display the axis label. 

style-element 
    Name of a style element. Only style attributes relevant for rendering the fill, line, data marker, or text will be used.

style-element (text-options) 
    Name of a style element, plus individual options to be used as style overrides. Any options not specified are derived
    from the specified style-element.

(text-options) 
COLOR=style-reference | color 
    specifies the color of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid
    attribute such as COLOR, CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use COLOR for text.

FAMILY =style-reference | "string" 
    specifies the font family of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTFAMILY.

SIZE=style-reference | dimension 
    specifies the font size of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTSIZE. 

STYLE=style-reference | NORMAL | ITALIC 
    specifies the font style of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTSTYLE. 

WEIGHT=style-reference | NORMAL | BOLD 
    specifies the font weight of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTWEIGHT.

[Syntax: LINEAROPTS=( linear-axis-options )] 
          
Specifies one or more linear-axis-options for a numeric interval axis.

[Syntax: LOGOPTS=( log-axis-options )] 
          
Specifies one or more log-axis-options for a log axis.

Reserves an area at the maximum end of the axis. No tick marks are displayed in the 
reserved area.

Default: AUTO

Range: 0 - 1. The sum of OFFSETMAX= and OFFSETMIN= should not be more than 1.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Reserves just enough area to fully display markers and other graphical features  near the maximum end of an axis.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Automatic offset applied that prevents axis labels and tick values from extending  beyond the axis length.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: The offset is expressed as a decimal proportion of the full axis length. Replace <number>  with an actual value.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Reserves an area at the mimimum end of the axis. No tick marks are displayed in the 
reserved area.

Default: AUTO

Range: 0 - 1. The sum of OFFSETMAX= and OFFSETMIN= should not be more than 1.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Reserves just enough area to fully display markers and other graphical features  near the minimum end of an axis.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Automatic offset applied that prevents axis labels and tick values from extending  beyond the axis length.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: The offset is expressed as a decimal proportion of the full axis length. Replace <number>  with an actual value.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SHORTLABEL="string"] 
          
Specifies an alternate axis label. This label is used when the default axis label 
or label specified by the LABEL= option is too long for the axis length. 

Default: no default

Interaction: This option is ignored if the DISPLAY= or DISPLAYSECONDARY= option does 
not display the axis label.

Tip: If the specified label is itself too long for the axis, it is truncated in the display.

[Syntax: style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options)] 
          
specifies the color and font attributes of the axis tick values.  
Default: The GraphValueText style element.

Interaction: This option is ignored if the DISPLAY= or DISPLAYSECONDARY= option does 
not display the axis label.

style-element 
    Name of a style element. Only style attributes relevant for rendering the fill, line, data marker, or text will be used.

style-element (text-options) 
    Name of a style element, plus individual options to be used as style overrides. Any options not specified are derived
    from the specified style-element.

(text-options) 
COLOR=style-reference | color 
    specifies the color of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid
    attribute such as COLOR, CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use COLOR for text.

FAMILY =style-reference | "string" 
    specifies the font family of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTFAMILY.

SIZE=style-reference | dimension 
    specifies the font size of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTSIZE. 

STYLE=style-reference | NORMAL | ITALIC 
    specifies the font style of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTSTYLE. 

WEIGHT=style-reference | NORMAL | BOLD 
    specifies the font weight of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTWEIGHT.

[Syntax: TIMEOPTS=( time-axis-options )] 
          
Specifies one or more time-axis-options for a time axis.
Specifies the type of axis to use.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Requests that the axis type be automatically determined, based on the overlay contents.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Use a DISCRETE X or X2 axis if possible. This setting is not available on a ROWAXIS  statement. The data for discrete axes can be character or numeric. For a column axis,  you can add a DISCRETEOPTS=( ) option list to customize this axis type.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Use a LINEAR axis if possible. You can add a LINEAROPTS=( ) option list to customize  this axis type.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Use a TIME axis if possible. Data for this axis must be SAS time, SAS date, or SAS  datetime values. You can add a TIMEOPTS=( ) option list to customize this axis type.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Use a LOG axis if possible. You can add a LOGOPTS=( ) option list to customize  this axis type.

only the external Y axes in the resulting graph.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ENDROWAXES ; 
      
Signals the end of a ROWAXES block.

Syntax: ENDROW2AXES ;
      
Signals the end of a ROW2AXES block.

Syntax: COLUMNHEADERS ;
      
Specifies a header for the primary (bottom) column-header position.

Syntax: COLUMN2HEADERS ; 
      
Specifies a header for the secondary (top) column-header position.

Syntax: ENDCOLUMNHEADERS ; 
      
Signals the end of a header block.

Syntax: ENDCELL ; 
      
Signals the end of a CELL block;

Syntax: CELLHEADER ; 
      
Signals the beginning of a CELLHEADER block; 

Within a CELL block, a CELLHEADER block can be used to generate one or more header 
lines within the cell. Each header line is specified on a separate GTL-statement 
within the CELLHEADER block. The header block is typically used to specify one or 
more text statements, but other statements are allowed within the block. 

Requirement: You must specify an ENDCELLHEADER statement to complete the CELLHEADER 
statement block. 

Tip: You can generate multiple headings by specifying multiple ODS-Graph-statement(s) 
within a CELLHEADER statement block.

Syntax: ENDCELLHEADER ; 
      
Signals the end of a CELLHEADER block.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ALIGN= TOP | BOTTOM | LEFT | RIGHT ] 
          
Specifies the location of the sidebar block.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Sidebar block spans across all columns on the top.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Sidebar block spans across all columns on the bottom.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Sidebar block spans across all row on the left.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Sidebar block spans across all row on the right.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ENDSIDEBAR ; 
      
Signals the end of a SIDEBAR block.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ALIGN= TOP | BOTTOM | LEFT | RIGHT ] 
          
Specifies the location of the sidebar block.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Sidebar block spans across all columns on the top.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Sidebar block spans across all columns on the bottom.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Sidebar block spans across all row on the left.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Sidebar block spans across all row on the right.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BACKGROUNDCOLOR=style-reference | color] 
          
Specifies the color of the inner margin background. 

style-reference 
A reference in the form style-element:style-attribute. Only the style-attribute named COLOR or CONTRASTCOLOR are used. 

color
specifies a color. 

Default: The graph wall color.  
Interaction: For this option to have any effect, the OPAQUE= option must be set to TRUE.  
Note: The inner margin background is set to the wall color even when WALLDISPLAY= NONE.

Syntax: GUTTER=dimension

Specifies the gap between nested layouts.

Default 0 
Note The default units for dimension are pixels.

Specifies whether the layout background is opaque (TRUE) or transparent (FALSE). The default 
is FALSE.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the layout background is transparent.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the layout background is opaque.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PAD=dimension | (pad-options)] 
          
Specifies the amount of extra space that is added inside the layout border. The default padding 
for all sides is 0. Values without units are in pixels (px). A unit must be provided if other than pixels.

dimension 
Specifies a dimension to use for the extra space at the left, right, top, and bottom of the layout border. 

(pad-options) 
Enables separate settings for the left, right, top, and bottom padding dimensions. Use the pad-options to
create non-uniform padding. These options must be enclosed in parentheses.

Values without units are in pixels (px). A unit must be provided if other than pixels.

    LEFT=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the left side. 

    RIGHT=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the right side. 

    TOP=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the top. 

    BOTTOM=dimension 
    specifies the amount of extra space added to the bottom.

Syntax: SEPARATOR=TRUE | FALSE

Specifies whether a separating line is drawn between the inner margin and the rest of the layout content.

Note: This option is valid in the first maintenance release of SAS 9.4 and later releases. 

Default: FALSE 
Tip: Use the SEPARATORATTRS= option to specify the attributes of the separating line.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that a separating line is drawn between the inner margin and the rest of the layout content.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that no separating line is drawn between the inner margin and the rest of the layout content.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: SEPARATORATTRS=style-element | style-element (line-options) | (line-options) 

Specifies the attributes of the inner margin separating line.

Note: This option is valid in the first maintenance release of SAS 9.4 and later releases. 

Default: The graphAxisLines style element 
Interaction: This option is ignored when SEPARATOR=FALSE.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ENDINNERMARGIN ; 
      
Signals the end of an ENDINNERMARGIN block.

Syntax: AXISCOMP axis-option(s); 
      
Specifies one or more axis options. 

Requirement: The AXISCOMP statement must be used inside of a primary or secondary column 
or row axis statement block. 

Requirement: You must specify at least one axis-option. 

Requirement: Within a COLUMNAXES statement block, the number of AXISCOMP statements must 
match the number of columns. 

Requirement: Within a ROWAXES statement block, the number of AXISCOMP statements must match 
the number of rows. 

Restriction:  You cannot use the THRESHOLDMAX or THRESHOLDMIN axis options with the 
AXISCOMP statement.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Controls the display of the axis features such as the axis label, line, tick marks, 
and values.

Default:  ALL 

Requirement:  The display-options must be enclosed in parentheses and separated by spaces.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the axis label, line, tick marks, and values are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that no axis features are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies one or more display options.     LABEL    displays the axis label.     LINE    displays the axis line.     TICKS    displays the axis tick marks.     VALUES    displays the values that are represented by the tick marks.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies whether evenly spaced integer values are used for tick marks.

Default:  FALSE 

Interaction:  The INTEGER= option is overridden by the TICKS= axis option. If the 
variable is not continuous, then INTEGER= option is ignored. 

Restriction:  The INTEGER= option is ignored on the X axis for bar charts, box plots, 
and histograms.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that evenly spaced integer values are used for tick marks.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that evenly spaced integer values are not used for tick marks.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: LABEL= 'string'] 
          
Specifies the axis label.

Default:  The default is to use the label of the column associated with the axis. 
If the label does not exist, the column name is used as the label. 

Note:   For a computed column, the default is the expression used to compute the column.

[Syntax: LABELFONTSIZE= dimension | style-reference] 
          
Specifies the font size used to display the axis label.

Default:  specified by the GraphLabelText:font_size style attribute.

[Syntax: THRESHOLDMAX= number] 
          
Specifies a threshold for displaying one more tick mark at the high end of the axis. 
The threshold is expressed as a decimal proportion of the tick interval, and it is 
measured from the potential tick value. If the largest data value lies within this 
threshold distance from the potential tick mark, then the tick mark is displayed.

Default:  .30 
Range:  0 - 1 

Interaction:  If the variable is not continuous, then the THRESHOLDMAX= option is ignored. 

Tip:  If the threshold is set to 0, the potential tick mark is never displayed. If the 
threshold is set to 1, the tick mark is always displayed. 

Tip:  Specifying THRESHOLDMIN=0 and THRESHOLDMAX=0 prevents the tick marks from extending 
beyond the data range. 

Tip:  Specifying THRESHOLDMIN=1 and THRESHOLDMAX=1 ensures that the data range is bounded 
by tick marks. 

Tip:  For the minimum axis length, set the THRESHOLDMIN= and THRESHOLDMAX= options to 0.

[Syntax: THRESHOLDMIN= number] 
          
Specifies a threshold for displaying one more tick mark at the low end of the axis. 
The threshold is expressed as a decimal proportion of the tick interval, and it is 
measured from the potential tick value. If the lowest data value lies within this 
threshold distance from the potential tick mark, then the tick mark is displayed.

Default:  .30 
Range:  0 - 1 

Interaction:  If the variable is not continuous, then the THRESHOLDMIN= option is ignored. 

Tip:  If the threshold is set to 0, the potential tick mark is never displayed. If the 
threshold is set to 1, the tick mark is always displayed. 

Tip:  Specifying THRESHOLDMIN=0 and THRESHOLDMAX=0 prevents the tick marks from extending 
beyond the data range. 

Tip:  Specifying THRESHOLDMIN=1 and THRESHOLDMAX=1 ensures that the data range is bounded 
by tick marks. 

Tip:  For the minimum axis length, set the THRESHOLDMIN= and THRESHOLDMAX= options to 0.

Specifies where tick marks are displayed. 
          
Default:  OUTSIDE

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Displays tick marks outside of the axis lines.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Displays tick marks inside of the axis lines.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Displays tick marks across the axis lines.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TICKS= ( numeric-list )] 
          
Specifies the tick values for the axis.

Requirement:  The numeric-list must be enclosed in parentheses and separated by spaces. 

Interaction:  If the variable is not continuous, then the TICKS= option is ignored. 

Tip:  If ticks are specified outside of the axis range, then the axis range is extended 
to display the ticks.

[Syntax: VALUEFONTSIZE= dimension | style-reference] 
          
Specifies the font size used to display the tick values.

Default:  specified by the GraphValueText:font_size style attribute.

StatementHelp.#cdata: Delimits an IF statement block.
